title: Bd officer
author: Bd officer
content: Although I still studied, I invested a small amount in Bitcoin. I will get married if I get a good job. Many people give many things to their wives as wedding gifts, I have a different plan. I am planning to gift bitcoin to my wife on her wedding day. Bitcoin is still illegal in my country so I invested with caution. On my wedding day I want to gift half of my investment to my wife. Should I gift bitcoin to my wife? I want your advice

comments.author: sokani
comments.body: Quote from: Bd officer on June 13, 2023, 01:54:02 PMAlthough I still studied, I invested a small amount in Bitcoin. I will get married if I get a good job. Many people give many things to their wives as wedding gifts, I have a different plan. I am planning to gift bitcoin to my wife on her wedding day. Bitcoin is still illegal in my country so I invested with caution. On my wedding day I want to gift half of my investment to my wife. Should I gift bitcoin to my wife? I want your adviceSincerely if you ask me, there are many thing to give ones spouse on a very special day like a wedding day but bitcoin is certainly the least of them. If I may ask does your wife know about Bitcoin? Does she know to trade or store Bitcoin? What does she know about the safest bitcoin wallet? Women treasures physical gifts a lot and there's no better time to wow her than your wedding day or night. My advice for you is to look for something lovely and tangible and present to your wife based on your financial strength and the bitcoin gift can come later.

comments.author: Solosanz
comments.body: Why you need to give it? and why it must be Bitcoin? if you're just want to teach Bitcoin to your wife in order to make she know how to access your Bitcoin when something bad happen, you don't need to give your coins to her! Even worst, Bitcoin is illegal in your country, your wife might tell to her friend or her family and force you to stop invest in Bitcoin, what do you think?

comments.author: isaac_clarke22
comments.body: Quote from: Bd officer on June 13, 2023, 01:54:02 PMAlthough I still studied, I invested a small amount in Bitcoin. I will get married if I get a good job. Many people give many things to their wives as wedding gifts, I have a different plan. I am planning to gift bitcoin to my wife on her wedding day. Bitcoin is still illegal in my country so I invested with caution. On my wedding day I want to gift half of my investment to my wife. Should I gift bitcoin to my wife? I want your adviceI don't want to rain your parade, OP but considering that you mentioned that Bitcoin is illegal in your country, you're just asking for a knock on the door from legal authorities. I assume you're from Bangladesh based on your post history? You could either just do it privately  or don't do it at all.  I understand that you want to give your wife the best present as much as possible, but there's plenty of ways to do it sweetly and nicely. You never want to ruin your honeymoon or at least be paranoid about it.

comments.author: Hyphen(-)
comments.body: Quote from: Bd officer on June 13, 2023, 01:54:02 PMShould I gift bitcoin to my wife? I want your adviceIt will be a very appreciative gift if your wife knows the value of Bitcoin and how it works.But how will the gift look since Bitcoin is not something physical that any other person will see? Will it look fancy or appreciative? because we know that women like something everyone will see and admire so that they will be happy, but nevertheless, if you can guide her through the Bitcoin process and tell her some good news about Bitcoin and its value, I am sure she will appreciate your gift.

comments.author: Doan9269
comments.body: Quote from: Bd officer on June 13, 2023, 01:54:02 PMAlthough I still studied, I invested a small amount in Bitcoin. I will get married if I get a good job. Bitcoin is still illegal in my country so I invested with caution. On my wedding day I want to gift half of my investment to my wife. Should I gift bitcoin to my wife? I want your adviceIt depends on your choice but there's nothing bad in giving her bitcoin as present, so it's something you both can agree on that after your wedding to choose bitcoin as your first investment asset, who knows maybe before your wedding day your country would have adopted bitcoin as a legal tender or make the use of bitcoin a legal means of making payments, all that you should know for now is that there's great advantage in using bitcoin than any other asset of investment because of it future advantage for making profits after holding.

comments.author: notocactus
comments.body: Quote from: Bd officer on June 13, 2023, 01:54:02 PMAlthough I still studied, I invested a small amount in Bitcoin. I will get married if I get a good job. Many people give many things to their wives as wedding gifts, I have a different plan. I am planning to gift bitcoin to my wife on her wedding day. Bitcoin is still illegal in my country so I invested with caution. On my wedding day I want to gift half of my investment to my wife. Should I gift bitcoin to my wife?If I am not wrong, in most countries, by laws, all assets two couples have during their marriage period are considered as co-owned by wife and husband.I know that you want to make your wife happy but is it necessary that bitcoin you have will be considered as co-owned by your wife if you buy it after your wedding, with a valid marriage certificate.In addition, it is risky if your wife does not know about Bitcoin, steps to keep it safe. You can teach your wife but probably she will have less experience than you and worse practice than you.Lastly, it is not her key, not her bitcoin. You create that wallet, give it as a gift to your wife but you know the wallet private key and you can get it back anytime.

comments.author: uneng
comments.body: Quote from: Bd officer on June 13, 2023, 01:54:02 PMShould I gift bitcoin to my wife? I want your adviceThat is a choice only you can make. A relationship between wife and husband is something very intimate which isn't from the business of other people. To give a Bitcoin gift to your wife might have a personal important meaning for you and to receive that gift might have an important meaning for your wife as well that most of us who are outside couldn't understand exactly. That is a matter of feeling. If you feel like you should gift her, do this. Just have self-confidence to make your choice based on what you think you should do and not on what other people think. After all, a marriage gets annoying and messy when the couple can't decide things by themselves and start taking the advices of others in consideration frequently.

comments.author: crwth
comments.body: Look at it this way, if you want to involve your wife in something that is illegal in your country, that’s not a good move. You might make it worse and depends on how your wife sees it as an investment or an asset. You didn’t mention any views of your wife Edith, so it might not be as well coming as what we might expect.Maybe invest your money from your bitcoin to something that is memorable to you and your wife. That would be a better wedding gift than bitcoin itself.

comments.author: Wapfika
comments.body: Quote from: Bd officer on June 13, 2023, 01:54:02 PM I am planning to gift bitcoin to my wife on her wedding day.Funny how you said her wedding on your wedding. Looks like someone is not happy with her.  Quote from: Bd officer on June 13, 2023, 01:54:02 PMBitcoin is still illegal in my country so I invested with caution. On my wedding day I want to gift half of my investment to my wife. Should I gift bitcoin to my wife? I want your adviceI don’t know why this kind of topic keep popping. There’s a lot of thread that same like this about buying Bitcoin or etc. while Bitcoin is illegal to your country.Seriously, you are giving your wife a gift that is illegal? You are putting her life at especially if she doesn’t know that she is committing a crime by accepting your gift. Just gave her a good life and that will make here happy for the rest of your life. Don’t make her life complicated and don’t involve her on your sneaky investment. I will support you on gifting Bitcoin if it’s legal. Think logically.

comments.author: imamusma
comments.body: Quote from: Bd officer on June 13, 2023, 01:54:02 PMAlthough I still studied, I invested a small amount in Bitcoin. I will get married if I get a good job. Many people give many things to their wives as wedding gifts, I have a different plan. I am planning to gift bitcoin to my wife on her wedding day. Bitcoin is still illegal in my country so I invested with caution. On my wedding day I want to gift half of my investment to my wife. Should I gift bitcoin to my wife? I want your adviceNo, I don't think you should give your future wife bitcoins on your wedding day. You have said that bitcoin is not an illegal asset in your country, so you will definitely be in trouble if you force yourself to give bitcoin for him openly. You have to take a different approach, of course you can give your wife bitcoins privately without being known by many people.But to be honest, I don't know what's your point in giving him bitcoin?

comments.author: bittraffic
comments.body: You may want to impress your wife but if she doesn't know how to trade BTC to fiat, she may not appreciate the gift. Unless you already have taught her about it so yep she will like it. In my experience, girls prefer the effort even if it's a small thing so know what they like. My best advice, buy something that will make her look good, something shiny like earrings and a necklace.  It's what they talk about when they gather with their friends and not BTC.

comments.author: Asuspawer09
comments.body: Quote from: Bd officer on June 13, 2023, 01:54:02 PMAlthough I still studied, I invested a small amount in Bitcoin. I will get married if I get a good job. Many people give many things to their wives as wedding gifts, I have a different plan. I am planning to gift bitcoin to my wife on her wedding day. Bitcoin is still illegal in my country so I invested with caution. On my wedding day I want to gift half of my investment to my wife. Should I gift bitcoin to my wife? I want your adviceI mean you getting married and all of your investment will be one with the investments of your wife so I guess no need to give it to him since she owns it as well already or maybe you could just teach him about Bitcoin so that he has the idea that you already own Bitcoin and it's her Bitcoin as well.It was a great wedding gift I think you could send your Bitcoin to your friends or family wedding I think, or just get them a whole wallet since most of them probably doesnt know Bitcoin or doesnt have a Bitcoin wallet. You could give them the whole wallet and with that, they might get interested in Bitcoin and probably become an investor in the future because of your gift also it would help them have a good mindset on investment and saving.Also, you might get in trouble since you mention Bitcoin is not legal in your country, in my opinion, you shouldn't teach someone to invest in Bitcoin or buy Bitcoin if it wasn't in first play legal your just putting them in trouble in the long run.

comments.author: Lorence.xD
comments.body: I don't know if I were your wife it'll be like just random to give your wife on your special day something they don't understand if she doesn't have idea to Bitcoin. Investing in Bitcoin is actually a good move, but just think something as a gift where your wife will have a memorable day by just receiving it. Because for sure you'll still have to educate her about Bitcoin once you gifted her if she doesn't have the knowledge. It doesn't need to be material thing maybe things that are useful for her to use. There's always a right time to open the bitcoin in other special days.

comments.author: TheUltraElite
comments.body: Quote from: Bd officer on June 13, 2023, 01:54:02 PMAlthough I still studied, I invested a small amount in Bitcoin. I will get married if I get a good job. Many people give many things to their wives as wedding gifts, I have a different plan. I am planning to gift bitcoin to my wife on her wedding day. Bitcoin is still illegal in my country so I invested with caution. On my wedding day I want to gift half of my investment to my wife. Should I gift bitcoin to my wife? I want your advice Why would you gift your beloved a article that is illegal in your country? Maybe in the future married life you can teach her about it, but why at the start?Consider she is not interested in bitcoin, but gold, what will you do then? Leave your wife or bitcoin? Tough question to answer if you ask me. While there are wives who are supportive of their husband's investments, you might want to consider their stance before tying the knot.My honest advice is to keep collecting bitcoin like the rest of your country members are doing discreetly and wait for the country's stance to change. Only then there is a chance that your upcoming spouse might be willing to accept it.

comments.author: Bd officer
comments.body: I understand many have said many ways. If I give my wife some idea about Bitcoin history first. I will warn about it as it is illegal in our country. I will explain him well. I will make a deal with my wife, when I sell bitcoins, I will give half to my wife.

comments.author: rat03gopoh
comments.body: Quote from: Bd officer on June 13, 2023, 01:54:02 PMBitcoin is still illegal in my country so I invested with caution.Well, you giving your wife something illegal is like putting your wife at risk of the law. I don't doubt how much you love your partner, but after all you're new to her family you have yet to explore how they'll react to this plan including knowing that you're a bitcoin fan.I wouldn't rush it if I were you, I think there's a better time for this plan.

comments.author: ajiz138
comments.body: Does your prospective partner understand bitcoin so that when you give it on the wedding day he will understand the value of the bitcoin that is given? If you still don't understand, then this will be very difficult for your wife, especially in your country where it is illegal, of course your wife is too public with bitcoin investments, so this will be a new problem, as much as possible, you and your wife must be as private as possible for this if you want to do it.I read an article about this and it exists but bitcoin is legal there so it won't be a problem while the wife who was given bitcoin already knows and understands how to properly store these assets.Maybe you can reconsider with other assets. I'm sure your future wife will be happy with any gift from you.

comments.author: bayudndy
comments.body: You must consider your spouse's taste and preferences when choosing a gift. If your wife is unfamiliar with Bitcoin or has no interest in crypto, it may not be the most suitable gift for her on your wedding day. Tangible and thoughtful gifts that match your wife's taste and show your love and commitment can mean more on such a special occasion. It could be a piece of jewelry, a handwritten letter, a personalized item, or an experience you both can enjoy together. Remember, it's important to understand your partner's wishes and choose a gift that aligns with their preferences and values. If you still want to introduce your wife to Bitcoin later on, you can do so after the wedding and take the time to educate her about it, making sure she's comfortable and enjoys exploring the world. electronic money.
